A **dwarvish roundshield** is a type of [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") and appears as a **large round shield** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Player [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") start the game with knowledge of the dwarvish roundshield - a commented-out line of code would give any dwarven character that started the game with a [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") a dwarvish roundshield instead.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

In addition to random generation, general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and used armor dealerships can sell dwarvish roundshields.

Live [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)") that [are generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword") and [dwarvish iron helm](/wiki/Dwarvish_iron_helm "Dwarvish iron helm") have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a dwarvish roundshield.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

When worn, a dwarvish roundshield grants 2 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and hinders [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Shield#Strategy](/wiki/Shield#Strategy "Shield")*

The dwarvish roundshield is likely to be the first 2 AC shield encountered, especially in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"). It is very heavy compared to most shields and provides no special properties, but can suffice as a means of additional AC until a lighter shield becomes available, such as a [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield"), [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), or [elven shield](/wiki/Elven_shield "Elven shield").

## History

The dwarvish roundshield first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Some variants may give dwarves (including dwarven characters) an AC bonus for wearing a dwarvish roundshield.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a dwarvish roundshield will produce a [large shield](/wiki/Large_shield "Large shield") and vice versa.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), the dwarvish roundshield grants +1 AC to dwarves that wear them, including dwarven characters.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the dwarvish roundshield grants +1 AC to dwarves that wear them, including dwarven characters.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), the dwarvish roundshield grants 3 AC, 0 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")1 while worn, and its weight is reduced to 80 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum").

Both variants also include a standard [roundshield](/wiki/Roundshield "Roundshield") that shares the unidentified appearance of a "round shield" with the dwarvish roundshield, whose appearance is changed since items can occur in various sizes corresponding to the size of monsters (e.g. a roundshield can be "large", "tiny" or "huge").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the dwarvish roundshield grants +1 AC to dwarves that wear them, including dwarven characters.

A dwarvish roundshield can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [dwarvish helm](/wiki/Dwarvish_helm "Dwarvish helm") and a [large shield](/wiki/Large_shield "Large shield"); a dwarvish roundshield can be combined with [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") to create [dwarvish chain mail](/wiki/Dwarvish_chain_mail "Dwarvish chain mail").

[Ashmar](/wiki/Ashmar "Ashmar") is an unaligned [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") dwarvish roundshield made of [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") that can only be created at a forge by combining the [artifact weapons](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") [Ogresmasher](/wiki/Ogresmasher "Ogresmasher") and [Trollsbane](/wiki/Trollsbane "Trollsbane"). While worn, it confers [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage"), hungerless [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and extrinsic [protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection") - it also sets the player's [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") to 25, and [prevents the wearer from being knocked backwards](/index.php?title=Steadfast\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Steadfast (page does not exist)"). Additionally, if Ashmar deflects an attack, it has a 1⁄4 chance of knocking the attacker back.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the dwarvish roundshield grants +1 AC to dwarves that wear them, including dwarven characters.

Upgrading a dwarvish roundshield will produce an [orcish shield](/wiki/Orcish_shield "Orcish shield"), and vice versa. Forging recipes are the same as in EvilHack.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 227](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L227): *Race-based substitutions for initial inventory*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L372): *default dwarvish armor*

It is very heavy compared to most shields and provides no special properties, but can suffice as a means of additional AC until a lighter shield becomes available, such as a small shield, shield of reflection, or elven shield.
